modules.description: Handles user authentication by managing user credentials and public keys. It provides functions to create users with optional passwords and public keys, and to look up users by name in a database of users. This module is used to authenticate SSH connections by verifying user identities against stored credentials and authorized keys.

This module implements SSH client and server operations over a Mirage flow, handling authentication, channel management, and data transmission. It provides functions to read and write data, manage flow shutdown and closure, and spawn an SSH server that processes channel requests such as PTY allocation, environment setup, and command execution. Concrete use cases include establishing secure shell sessions, executing remote commands over SSH, and managing interactive terminals with PTY resizing.

This module enables secure SSH communication in a MirageOS environment by integrating user authentication with SSH client and server operations. It supports key-based and password authentication, user management, and handling of SSH channels for data transmission, PTY allocation, and command execution. Developers can use it to build applications that securely authenticate users, establish encrypted SSH sessions, and remotely execute commands with full terminal emulation. Example uses include automated deployment tools, secure remote monitoring systems, and virtual terminal services.
